newsitem.title: USA: Canada spot normal butane ignores U.S. strength.
newsitem.headline: Canada spot normal butane ignores U.S. strength.

text.p: Spot prices of Canada liquids shrugged off the increase in U.S. normal butane prices this week and settled into the summer mode of building up inventories, players said Thursday
Despite a nearly two cent rise in U.S. butane prices, values in eastern Canada drfited down a half cent in quiet trade.
Sarnia hub material was pegged between 34.50 cents and 35.00 cents a gallon in lack of trade. There needs to be a six to seven cent spread to make it viable to send Canadian butane south.
Field butane in western hub of Edmonton dropped 2.75 cents since last Thursday.
"With the gasoline blending season over there is just not that much happening at the moment," said a Sarnia player. "Canada is pretty much ignoring now what is going on in the U.S."
Sarnia isobutane, however, jumped three cents amid some activity and tight supply. The product was pegged at 43.25/43.75 cents a gallon.
